cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, then turning north-northwest inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border, roughly in the Cameron/Lake Charles, LA area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City LA; Storm-Surge Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS, incl. Lakes Pontchartrain/Maurepas/Borgne
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: east of Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River; Hurricane Warning west of port (San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA); Storm-Surge Warning: San Luis Pass TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast through southwest and south-central Louisiana
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (2–4 in. expected, isolated higher amounts up to 6 in.)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (2–4 ft possible in Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas and adjacent Mississippi River reaches)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the core tracks slightly east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in tidal portions of the Mississippi River and the adjoining lakes, with minor coastal flooding and back-water rise up river channels.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 2–4 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood pockets and poor-drainage issues at the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes are possible in outer rain bands Wednesday night–Thursday; elevated waves and strong rip currents on nearby open waters will hamper ship movements.
